name: Lifeslice
tagline: Capture slices of your computer life
body:
### About

LifeSlice began as a simple script that would take my picture once an hour. It now can record a host of stats about your time in front of the computer.
* Webcam picture of you
* Screenshot of your monitor(s)
* Word count, character count, and backspaces. 
* Mouse clicks, scrolls, and distance traveled.
* Applications used and number of switches

All of the data is viewable in a simple built-in browser. [Explore some of my statistics to see.](http://wanderingstan.com/drop/lifeslice2/html/slicebrowser-day-d3.html?date=2013-08-21) For developers, this data is stored as both a csv file and a SQLite database.

![LifeSlice screenshot](http://wanderingstan.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/lifeslice-screenshot.png)

LifeSlice is open-source and contributions welcomed. 

[The latest official release is available as a DMG here.](http://wanderingstan.com/apps/lifeslice/LifeSlice.dmg)

Here is a talk given at the San Francisco Quanitifed Self meetup shortly after development began.
[![Alt text](/../readme-files/readme-files/lifeslice-qs-talk-vimeo-screenshot.png?raw=true "Quantified Self Talk")](http://vimeo.com/42239564)
